alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 19 at 5:58AM EST until February 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From early this morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to recede to around 18.8 feet by around 1 PM EST today and recede further to around 17.3 feet around 7 AM EST on Monday. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
